hypothesis_content.title: Liquidation Cascade Amplification in High-Funding Environments
hypothesis_content.statement: In a high perpetual swap funding rate environment (≥0.05% per 8hr), an initial catalyst-driven price move of ≥3% that triggers liquidations exceeding $150M in 1 hour will be amplified into a short-term trend as sequential long/short squeezes cascade, with momentum decaying predictably after funding resets to neutral.
hypothesis_content.rationale: High absolute funding rates indicate crowded one-way leverage. A catalyst provides the initial shove. The first wave of liquidations pushes price further, triggering stop-losses and deleveraging in a reflexive cascade. This creates a self-fueling move that typically exhausts only when the extreme leverage (funding) is flushed out.
entry_conditions: BTC aggregate perpetual funding rate sustained ≥0.05% (positive) or ≤-0.05% (negative) for 24+ hours
Catalyst (CPI, ETF flow, large spot market order) triggers ≥3% price move in 1 hour
1-hour cross-exchange liquidation volume exceeds $150M in the direction opposite the initial funding bias (e.g., negative price move during high positive funding)
Price continues moving in the catalyst direction for the next 2 hours after the liquidation spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: Aggregate funding rate crosses back through zero (e.g., from positive to slightly negative)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price retraces >75% of the initial catalyst-driven move (pre-liquidation spike)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 60% of signals see price continue in the catalyst direction for 6+ hours post-entry, or the median return is not significantly greater than the return of the initial catalyst move alone.
